page.title: 08THE COTTAGE STABLES
page.content: The{National Hunt}racing stables in Bishops Itchington are housed in what used to be two cottages built in 1889 and which belonged to the big house further up the lane. One of these cottages used to be a dairy. The buildings are of red brick and inside the walls are planked with wood. There are eight horses which are looked after by Mr. Wilmer Mann and his son Robert. When the stables are busy Mrs. Betty Mann and Robert's wife, Sue help out. They work from 6.3O a.m. - 5.3O p.m. every day. The{ {blacksmith}is Mr. Jeffs from Northend. He has been coming for seventy years and is now helped by his son. The{horses}race at about eight race courses including{Stratford}and{ {Warwick.} In the races they are ridden by some well known{jockeys.}
